    • Method Detail

      • getNewSecureDocBuilderFactory

        public static javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory getNewSecureDocBuilderFactory()
        Sun's default Jax RI parser, and Apache xerces honor all these security feature. But weblogic internal document factory does not honor looks like. Hence for weblogic, we may have to force another parser like sun default parser by specifying -Djavax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory=com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl in weblogic server startup script.

      • selectNodeIteratorForDefaultNamespace

        public static org.w3c.dom.traversal.NodeIterator selectNodeIteratorForDefaultNamespace(org.w3c.dom.Node contextNode,
                                                                                       java.lang.String xpath)
        For documents with namespaces(e.g. webservice calls which has entire api input in default namespace), Xpath query for default namespace tags, works only if prefix is added to the search path. This seems to be XSLT 1.0 spec limitation. Although not sure why XPathAPI could not handle it internally. E.g if prefix is set to px then 'Order' should be searched as 'px:Order' '/OrderLine/Order' should be searched as '/px:OrderLine/px:Order' 'OrderLine/Order/@OrderName' should be searched as 'px:OrderLine/px:Order/@OrderName'. contextNode - Node in which the xpath needs to be searched. xpath - The xpath expression without any prefixes. NodeIterator or Null. Null is returned when namespace URI is not present/Xpath is void.

      • selectSingleNodeForDefaultNamespace

        public static org.w3c.dom.Node selectSingleNodeForDefaultNamespace(org.w3c.dom.Node contextNode,
                                                                   java.lang.String xpath)
        For documents with namespaces(e.g. webservice calls which has entire api input in default namespace), Xpath query for default namespace tags, works only if prefix is added to the search path. This seems to be XSLT 1.0 spec limitation. Although not sure why XPathAPI could not handle it internally. E.g if prefix is set to px then 'Order' should be searched as 'px:Order' '/OrderLine/Order' should be searched as '/px:OrderLine/px:Order' 'OrderLine/Order/@OrderName' should be searched as 'px:OrderLine/px:Order/@OrderName'. contextNode - Node in which the xpath needs to be searched. xpath - The xpath expression without any prefixes. Node or Null. Null is returned when namespace URI is not present/xpath is void. Also when node not found.
